ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
I worry that whenever I eat during the day, bloating and distension in my belly will get worse
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I get anxious when I go to a new restaurant
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I often worry about problems in my belly
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I have a difficult time enjoying myself because I cannot get my mind off of discomfort in my belly
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I often fear that I won't be able to have a normal bowel movement
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: Because of fear developing abdominal discomfort, I seldom try new foods
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: No matter what I eat, I will probably feel uncomfortable
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: As soon as I feel abdominal discomfort I begin to worry and feel anxious
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: When I enter a place I haven't been before, one of the first things I do is to look for a bathroom
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I am constantly aware of the feelings I have in my belly
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I often feel discomfort in my belly could be a sign of a serious illness
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: As soon as I awake, I worry that I will have discomfort in my belly during the day
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: When I feel discomfort in my belly, it frightens me
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: In stressful situations, my belly bothers me a lot
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I constantly think about what is happening inside my belly
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Moderately agree; 3=Mildly agree; 4=Mildly disagree; 5=Moderately disagree; 6=Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: VSI Score (15-item)
Notes: 15 item version. Sum of vsi1 through vsi15

ElementDescription: VSI Score (13-item)
Notes: 13 item version. Sum of vsi1 through vsi15 (excluding vsi2 and vsi9)
